briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Dapagliflozin in Combination With Metformin in Type 2 Diabetes Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Type 2 Diabetes
* Treated with oral anti-diabetic drug therapy therapy including Metformin for at least 8 weeks prior to enrolment
* HbA1c \>6.5% and \</=10%

Exclusion Criteria:

* Type 1 Diabetes
* Insulin therapy within one year of enrolment
* Renal (kidney) failure or dysfunction

outcomeMeasures.title: Adjusted Mean Change in HbA1c Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: To assess the effect of dapagliflozin plus metformin compared to glipizide plus metformin on the absolute change from baseline in HbA1c level after 52 weeks double-blind treatment in patients with type 2 diabetes who have inadequate glycaemic control on 1500 mg/day or higher doses of metformin therapy alone.

outcomeMeasures.title: Adjusted Mean Change in Body Weight
outcomeMeasures.description: To assess the effect of dapagliflozin plus metformin compared to glipizide plus metformin on body weight after 52 weeks double-blind treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Participants With at Least One Episode of Hypoglycemia
outcomeMeasures.description: To assess the effect of dapagliflozin plus metformin treatment compared to glipizide plus metformin on the occurrence of hypoglycemic events. Least Squares Mean represents the percent of participants adjusted for HbA1c baseline value.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Participants With Body Weight Reduction of at Least 5%
outcomeMeasures.description: To evaluate the effect of dapagliflozin plus metformin compared to glipizide plus metformin on body weight assessed by a reduction after 52 weeks of at least 5% compared to baseline. Least Squares Mean represents the percent of participants adjusted for baseline value.
